member.name: T:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Wrap
member.summary: Wraps a set of objects (points, edges, faces or bodies) around a target body

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Wrap.Create(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Selection.ISelection,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Selection.ISelection,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.CommandOptions.WrapOptions,SpaceClaim.Commands.Script.ICommandInfo)
member.summary: Wraps a set of objects (points, edges, faces or bodies) around a target body
member.remarks: If the objects to be wrapped are faces, the target body should be smooth and single-curved. Doubly curved surfaces on the target can result in deformation of the wrapped object or failure if the curvature is large. If the objects to be wrapped are edges or sketch curves, the target can contain sharp edges at the boundary of faces.

member.summary: Wraps a set of objects (points, edges, faces or bodies) around a target body
member.remarks: If the objects to be wrapped are faces, the target body should be smooth and single-curved. Doubly curved surfaces on the target can result in deformation of the wrapped object or failure if the curvature is large. If the objects to be wrapped are edges or sketch curves, the target can contain sharp edges at the boundary of faces.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidateCoincidentSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary:
For coincident everything is valid for the first selection
For the second selection If the first selection was a point that any curve or curve point is valid. If the first selection was a curve, than only points or the same curve type is valid, except for splines which are invalid for every curve type

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidateEqualRadiusSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary: Both selections must be circles

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidateParallelSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary: Both selections must either be a line or an ellipse

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidatePerpendicularSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary: Every curve type is valid for perpendicular. Only points (curve points or standalone points) aren't allowed

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidateTangentSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary: Tangent allows everything except points and lines on the second selection if a line was selected first

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Commands.Constraint.ValidateMidpointSelections(SpaceClaim.IEvaluation,SpaceClaim.IEvaluation)
member.summary: Any combination of a line/circular arc and a curvepoint is allowed

member.summary: Gets the master for this object. If this object is a master, the object itself is returned
member.remarks:
Derived interfaces override Master to return the appropriate master type. For example, the interface overrides and returns a .
The Master can be obtained even if the object .
See for an overview of instances, occurrences, and masters.

member.summary: Gets the transform to master-space

See for an overview of instances, occurrences, and masters.

member.summary: The DesignFaceExtensions class provides direct access to common face evaluators

member.summary: Builds trimmed curves along a face's iso-lines
member.param: Direction of iso-line, along U = true, along V = false

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.GetFacePoint(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines a point on a face at the given proportion (0-1) of the U and V parameters

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.GetFaceNormal(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines a normal on a face at the given proportion (0-1) of the U and V parameters
member.returns: The orientation of the face with respect to the surface is accounted for.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.Evaluate(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the face at the given U and V parameters
member.remarks: This function evaluates the surface directly and does not account for any reverse orientation the face might have.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.EvalProportion(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the face at the given proportion (0-1) of the U and V parameters
member.remarks: This function evaluates the surface directly and does not account for any reverse orientation the face might have.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.GetTangentChain(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace)
member.summary: Gets the tangent chain containing this face

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.EvalStart(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace)
member.summary: Starting evaluation of the face
member.remarks: The start evaluation of the face is defined as the {0,0} parameter value of the face's surface. This might or might not be on the face itself.
This function evaluates the surface directly and does not account for any reverse orientation the face might have.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.EvalMid(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace)
member.summary: Middle evaluation of the face
member.remarks: The middle evaluation of the face is defined as the {0.5,0.5} parameter value (in proportion) of the face's surface. This might or might not be on the face itself.
This function evaluates the surface directly and does not account for any reverse orientation the face might have.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.EvalEnd(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace)
member.summary: Ending evaluation of the face
member.remarks: The end evaluation of the face is defined as the {1.0,1.0} parameter value of the face's surface. This might or might not be on the face itself.
This function evaluates the surface directly and does not account for any reverse orientation the face might have.

member.summary: Gets a list of face regions and tangent chains

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Extensions.DesignFaceExtensions.GetConnection(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDesignFace,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the n'th face region or tangent chain

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.GeometryHelper.PointSetClassification(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.IDocObject,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Point set classification of a point and a document object
member.remarks: All dimensions of objects are supported, including Points, Bounded Curves, Bounded Surfaces and Solids. The point will be classified as either ON or OFF (or Inside) the object. The tolerance is 1e-8 in meters.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.GeometryHelper.PointSetClassification(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Selection.ISelection,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Point set classification of a point and a selection
member.remarks: All dimensions of objects are supported, including Points, Bounded Curves, Bounded Surfaces and Solids. The point will be classified as either ON or OFF (or Inside) the object. The tolerance is 1e-8 in meters.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.GeometryHelper.PointSetClassification(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Curve,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Point set classification of a point and an unbounded geometry curve
member.remarks: The point will be classified as either ON or OFF the curve. The curve is not limited to any parameter bounds. The tolerance is 1e-8 in meters.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.GeometryHelper.PointSetClassification(SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Surface,SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Point set classification of a point and an unbounded geometry surface
member.remarks: For a general surface, classification returned will be ON or OFF. If the surface represents a half space (e.g. Plane, Sphere, Torus), the classification will be an ON, INSIDE or OUTSIDE.

member.name: M:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.GeometryHelper.Rotate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Point},SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Geometry.Line,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a list of new points rotated around a line and an angle

member.summary: Generate a direction based on a set of objects (face, edge or body)
member.remarks: The following shows the direction based on selection type: Face - Normal at the click point Edge - Tangent at the click point Body - Normal at the click point Directions are averaged with multiple selections.

member.summary: Generate a point based on a selection and mouse click
member.remarks: Directions are averaged with multiple selections.

member.summary: Commands and interfaces in Beta. We recommend saving all work before executing any of these commands.

member.name: T:SpaceClaim.Api.V18.Scripting.Helpers.Beta.InputHelper
member.summary: Helper functions to build interactive tools

members.member:
Pauses the script and open interactive tool to get user input. Pass in any number of variables as options to be displayed in the options panel. The variable will be displayed according to its type:
string -- String TextBox number -- Numerical TextBox bool -- Checkbox enum -- Dropdown color -- Color Picker function -- Button
///
option1 = "" option2 = False option3 = 1.2 option4 = ValueType.Angle option5 = Color.Red result = Beta.InputHelper.PauseAndGetInput("My interactive tool", option1, option2, option3, option4, option5)

members.member:
Create a power selection that enumerates all selection relations based on given reference relation and search options
The reference selection The search options The filter relation category
Power selection
///
option = PowerSearchOptions() option.SelectSeed = False pSel = PowerSelection.All(Selection.SetActive(), option)
pSel.FilterCategory(RelationCategory.Bodies)
for sel in pSel: print sel.FullName
